messages.title: LOCAL RESIDENT AND PUBLIC SERVANT
messages.content: Bob was in the British Army - receiving a Military MBE - prior to becoming the Island's MP. He served in Afghanistan and Iraq, returning home to the island two tours. Bob was twice elected as an Isle of Wight councillor. He lives near Brighstone.

messages.title: CHAMPIONING THE ISLE OF WIGHT IN WESTMINSTER
messages.content: Bob is a passionate advocate for our island - and he gets results. Working with others, he has secured £48m for the NHS and £26m for Island Line. Sandown School and Venture Quays have been saved. Bob will continue to deliver for the Isle of Wight.

messages.title: CONVINCED WHITEHALL TO RECOGNISE ISLAND STATUS
messages.content: Following Bob's input, the Government is now looking at the extra cost of delivering public services in our island community. He persuaded the Prime Minister that we need an Island Deal - and has now set out an evidence-based case for fair funding.

messages.title: PROTECTING OUR ISLAND & HOUSING FOR ISLANDERS
messages.content: As an Islander, Bob has campaigned to improve the Island Plan. He is working with the Council to protect green fields, reduce housing targets and prioritise homes for local families. Bob will push for greater environmental protections for the Island.

keyPolicies.policyDescription: Bob Seely supports the completion of Brexit and opposes candidates who might overturn it.
Securing a better deal for the Isle of Wight, including securing funding for NHS and local infrastructure like the Island Line.
Support for economic growth in Island industries and lower taxes for hard-working local families.
More funding for all pupils in every Island school.
Improve the Island Plan, protect green fields, reduce housing targets, prioritize homes for local families, and push for greater environmental protections.

issues.brexitEurope: Getting Brexit done with Bob Seely, Better deal for the Isle of Wight with Bob Seely rather than Corbyn's candidate, The hard-left Greens, working with Labour to stop Brexit
issues.economy: Support for economic growth in Island industries, Lower taxes for hard-working local families
issues.education: More funding for all pupils in every Island school
issues.environment: Protecting our island & housing for islanders, Greater environmental protections for the island
issues.governance: Convinced Whitehall to recognise island status, Set out an evidence-based case for fair funding

housing.content: Improve the Island Plan, protect green fields, reduce housing targets, prioritize homes for local families

leaflet.personalStatement: I have worked relentlessly to be a strong and effective voice we need. Now that a General Election is taking place, I am seeking a second term as the Island's MP to carry on with this crucial work.

politicalExperience.achievements: Secured £48m for the NHS and £26m for Island Line, Sandown School and Venture Quays have been saved.
